title: A Cobham theorem for scalar multiplication
authors: Philipp Hieronymi, Sven Manthe, Chris Schulz
abstract:
Let $\alpha,\beta \in \mathbb{R}_{>0}$ be such that $\alpha,\beta$ are
quadratic and $\mathbb{Q}(\alpha)\neq \mathbb{Q}(\beta)$. Then every subset of
$\mathbb{R}^n$ definable in both $(\mathbb{R},{<},+,\mathbb{Z},x\mapsto \alpha
x)$ and $(\mathbb{R},{<},+,\mathbb{Z},x\mapsto \beta x)$ is already definable
in $(\mathbb{R},{<},+,\mathbb{Z})$. As a consequence we generalize
Cobham-Semenov theorems for sets of real numbers to $\beta$-numeration systems,
where $\beta$ is a quadratic irrational.
subjects: Computing Research Repository/Logic in Computer Science
